trigger: Overexpression of <extra_id_0> DR-nm23 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a protein encoded by a member of the nm23 gene family , inhibits granulocyte differentiation and induces apoptosis in 32Dc13 myeloid cells .
Chronic myelogenous leukemia evolves in two clinically distinct stages : a chronic and a blast crisis phase .
The molecular changes associated with chronic phase to blast crisis transition are largely unknown .

We have identified a cDNA clone , <extra_id_0> DR-nm23 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , differentially expressed in a blast-crisis cDNA library , which has approximately 70 % sequence similarity to the putative metastatic suppressor genes , <extra_id_0> nm23-H1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> nm23-H2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The deduced amino acid sequence similarity to the proteins encoded by these two latter genes is approximately 65 % and includes domains and amino acid residues ( the leucine zipper-like and the RGD domain , a serine and a histidine residue in the NH2 - and in the COOH-terminal portion of the protein , respectively ) postulated to be important for nm23 function .

<extra_id_0> DR-nm23 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA is preferentially expressed at early stages of myeloid differentiation of highly purified <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells .

Its constitutive expression in the myeloid precursor 32Dc13 cell line , which is growth-factor dependent for both proliferation and differentiation , results in inhibition of granulocytic differentiation induced by <extra_id_0> granulocyte colony-stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and causes apoptotic cell death .

These results are consistent with a role for <extra_id_0> DR-nm23 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in normal hematopoiesis and raise the possibility that its overexpression contributes to differentiation arrest , a feature of blastic transformation in chronic myelogenous leukemia .
